name: Oil and Filter Change
description: Change engine oil and replace oil filter on GM LS Gen IV engines

steps.action: Position drain pan under oil drain plug
steps.details: Locate the oil drain plug on the bottom of the oil pan. Position your drain pan directly underneath, accounting for the angle of oil flow.
warnings: If engine is warm, oil will be hot - use caution
Ensure drain pan is large enough (6+ quarts)

steps.details: Using a 15mm socket or wrench, loosen and remove the drain plug. Be prepared for oil to flow immediately. Allow all oil to drain completely - this may take several minutes.
warnings: Don't drop the drain plug into the pan

steps.details: While oil is draining, locate the oil filter. Using an oil filter wrench if needed, turn the filter counterclockwise to remove. Some oil will spill from the filter - have rags ready.
warnings: Filter may be tight - use proper wrench to avoid damage

steps.details: Apply a thin layer of fresh oil to the gasket on the new filter. Thread the new filter on by hand until the gasket contacts the mounting surface, then tighten an additional 3/4 turn by hand.
warnings: Do not over-tighten - hand tight plus 3/4 turn only
Verify old gasket is not stuck to engine

steps.details: Ensure drain plug washer is in good condition (replace if needed). Thread drain plug in by hand to prevent cross-threading, then torque to specification.
warnings: Do not over-torque - this can strip the oil pan threads

steps.details: Remove oil fill cap on valve cover. Using a funnel, add the specified amount of oil (typically 6 quarts for LS engines). Check your owner's manual for exact capacity and oil specification.
warnings: Do not overfill - check level with dipstick
Use oil meeting GM specification (typically 5W-30 dexos1)

steps.action: Verify oil level and check for leaks
steps.details: Replace fill cap. Start engine and let it run for 30 seconds, then shut off. Wait 2 minutes for oil to settle, then check level with dipstick. Add oil if needed. Inspect drain plug and filter for leaks.

reinstallNotes: Dispose of old oil properly at a recycling center or auto parts store. Reset oil life monitor if equipped. Record mileage and date of oil change for your records.
